author: EdJenner
title: Lone Dem Congressman Pushes Back Against Maine Kicking Trump Off Ballot
text: Terms of Service DMCA Advertise with us Affiliates Media Inquiries About Featured A lone Democrat congressman from Maine spoke up for the rule of law Thursday asserting states were wrong to remove former President Donald Trump from ballots because he hasn’t been convicted of anything. In a bold move splitting from his party on the matter, Rep. Jared Golden (D-Maine) said despite previously voting to impeach Trump, he believed the former president should be able to run for office in 2024 because of the nation’s governing judicial principle: innocent until proven guilty. “I voted to impeach Donald Trump for his role in the January 6th insurrection,” Golden [wrote on X.](https://twitter.com/RepGolden/status/1740544590242074827) “I do not believe he should be reelected as president of the United States.” “However,” he continued, “we are a nation of laws, therefore until he is actually found guilty of the crime of insurrection, he should be allowed on the ballot.” The Democrat’s bold statement sets him apart from the rest of his party, highlighting their lack of interest in preserving free and fair elections. Rep. Golden’s comments counter the order from his state’s Secretary of State Shenna Bellows, who on Thursday [declared](https://www.infowars.com/posts/breaking-maine-secretary-of-state-removes-trump-from-2024-ballot/) Trump would be stricken from the state’s primary ballot for allegedly inciting the J6 “insurrection.” Of course, Donald Trump has never been charged with, let alone convicted of, insurrection. The state of Colorado last week also moved to boot Trump from the state’s primary ballot, however, the state’s Republican party has [appealed the decision](https://www.infowars.com/posts/breaking-trump-back-on-colorado-primary-ballot/) to the US Supreme Court which will decide whether to hear the case or affirm the Colorado Supreme Court’s decision. Many suspect other Democrat-led states will follow the leads of Colorado and Maine, as the establishment launches an all-out effort to rig the 2024 election by denying voters the right to vote for their candidate of choice. The globalists are increasing their attacks on Infowars and the stakes have never been higher! Please consider [donating](https://infowars.iljmp.com/4/ebeuu) and visit [InfowarsStore.com](https://www.infowarsstore.com/) for merch, nutraceuticals and survival gear. posted 6 hours ago posted 7 hours ago posted 8 hours ago posted 10 hours ago

author: Álvaro López
title: Los sindicatos exigen al unísono a la Consejería de Salud el cese de la gerente de Jaén por "maltrato psicológico"
text:
Los sindicatos sanitarios de la provincia de Jaén han solicitado formalmente a la Dirección General de Personal de la Consejería de Salud que cese a la gerente responsable de los distritos Jaén y Jaén Sur, Sandra Moraleda. CSIF, UGT, CCOO, Satse y Sindicato Médico denuncian que la directora de estas áreas sanitarias está ejerciendo “maltrato psicológico” contra los trabajadores al adoptar medidas “arbitrarias” que afectan a su trabajo diario. Pese a la queja sindical, desde el Servicio Andaluz de Salud (SAS) no tienen previsto relegarla de su puesto. La falta de pediatras se ceba con Sierra Mágina de Jaén al quedarse sin médico especialista durante el verano
En concreto, los representantes de los profesionales sanitarios de los distritos Jaén y Jaén Sur argumentan que la gerente actual está generando un clima de “malestar” porque la relación con ella es “difícil”: “Además de disponer de los trabajadores del centro de forma arbitraria, justificando los cambios por necesidades organizativas y olvidando los derechos de estos, se niega a mantener un dialogo con las diferentes organizaciones sindicales, e imponiendo siempre su criterio, sin escuchar a razones, ni atender a la Ley Orgánica 11/1985, de 2 de agosto, de Libertad Sindical”, lamentan.
Según estos sindicatos, la directora de ambas áreas sanitarias está incumpliendo sistemáticamente pactos firmados entre los representantes sindicales y el propio SAS. Eso, a juicio de las mismas fuentes, “genera un maltrato psicológico en todos los trabajadores, que se ven coaccionados a obedecer sin posibilidad de queja, ante el temor de represalias”. Si bien no apuntan a ejemplos concretos y van a esperar a reunirse con la delegada de Salud en Jaén, Elena González, -una reunión que ya han solicitado, pero que desde el SAS dicen no tener constancia- los sindicatos indican que el ambiente es tenso entre las dos partes.
CSIF, UGT, CCOO, Satse y Sindicato Médico han comunicado a la Dirección General de Personal del SAS que los afectados están teniendo que hacer frente a “diferentes tipos de desplantes y actitudes arbitrarias”. Pese a que, como indican, han intentado que el diálogo fuese el “eje” de la relación con la gerencia, los sindicatos lamentan que esto ha sido imposible. “El límite de su tolerancia ha llegado al final, y vista la persistencia de sus actuaciones y su negativa a cambiar de actitud, no les queda otra opción que solicitar su cese”.
Más problemas sanitarios Mientras desde el SAS explican que no está previsto cesar a la responsable de los distritos de Jaén y Jaén Sur, sin entrar al fondo de la reclamación de los sindicatos, lo cierto es que la situación de los centros de salud y hospitales de la zona no es la más favorable. Sin ir más lejos, los celadores del Hospital Neurotraumatológico de Jaén llevan meses reclamando mejoras para acabar con el estrés que padecen y las listas de espera para intervenciones quirúrgicas están en niveles elevados, lastradas por falta de efectivos en categorías tan concretas como la de anestesista .
No obstante, el panorama no es mucho mejor en el resto de la provincia. Este verano se han producido problemas relacionados con la falta de plantilla médica sobre todo en lo relacionado con los pediatras. Municipios como Jimena, Albánchez o Garcíez han permanecido los meses de julio y agosto sin posibilidad de que los niños de estos pueblos pudiesen ser vistos por un especialista. Una tendencia que, según los alcaldes de esas localidades, va a peor cada año ante la falta de contratos que alarguen las estancias de los sanitarios que acuden a estas zonas conocidas como de “difícil cobertura”.
Paralelamente, la semana pasada, en el Parlamento de Andalucía se ha presentado, a propuesta del PSOE, un plan de choque para aligerar las listas de espera en Jaén. A día de hoy, hay más de 110.000 jienenses -de un total de 630.000- a la espera de una intervención quirúrgica y, de hecho, el complejo hospitalario de Jaén es uno de los que lidera el ranking de demora en toda Andalucía. Por otro lado, está encima la mesa la posibilidad de renovar diferentes ambulatorios en la provincia para que puedan dar mejor cobertura a los entornos más rurales. Los de Cazorla y Jódar son dos de los que están en esta lista.
 Sevilla y dónde, y

author: archyde
title: New U.S. sanctions on Iran goal corporations, ships
text:
2024-06-27 19:12:24
Why recruiting extremist spiritual figures in Israel may undermine Netanyahu’s authorities?
Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is waging a political confrontation on one other entrance after the Supreme Courtroom dominated this week that ultra-Orthodox Israelis should be recruited within the conflict between Israel and Hamas within the Gaza Strip.
The problem has lengthy been a thorn in Israeli politics and will result in the breakup of the right-wing coalition and new elections.
In Israel, Jewish women and men are required to serve within the navy, whereas spiritual service members are exempt from navy service as a way to commit themselves to studying in spiritual establishments and preserving the identification of the individuals.
Orthodox, who adhere to a strict interpretation of Jewish legislation and dwell in remoted communities, declare that their Torah research is designed to guard the nation like navy service.
“Till now there has all the time been a authorized foundation to not draft them into the navy,” stated Shoki Friedman, deputy director of the Jewish Individuals Coverage Institute.
Nonetheless, he stated Orthodoxy had “no exceptions and no authorized foundation not to take action”.
Demonstrators demand equality in Israeli navy service throughout a protest in Jerusalem on February 26, 2024 (Reuters)
A rising variety of Israelis are calling for ultra-Orthodox males to bear the “equal burden” of navy service, however it’s unclear how the courtroom’s ruling will have an effect on Orthodox recruitment in observe.
A whole lot of hundreds of Israeli reservists have been serving for months since October 7 within the Gaza Strip, the occupied West Financial institution and alongside the northern border with Lebanon.
In accordance with Friedman, about 66,000 ultra-Orthodox spiritual faculty college students are at the moment eligible to be drafted into the navy.
Some spiritual figures have served within the navy.
Israeli military human assets officers advised Congress final February that the variety of ultra-Orthodox Jewish males recruited yearly has remained regular at round 1,200 since 2019, down from about 3,000 in 2017.
The courtroom’s choice doesn’t imply that every one eligible individuals will obtain subpoenas this week. Any efforts by the Israeli authorities to recruit Orthodox males into the military will solely happen within the coming months.
Friedman stated, “The query is about tempo: Will it add 3,000 individuals now, 6,000 individuals subsequent 12 months, or will it keep on the very gradual tempo that we’re seeing now?”
Barak Medina, a legislation professor on the Hebrew College of Jerusalem, argued that spiritual establishments whose college students evaded the invoice now face important authorities finances cuts, in some circumstances as a lot as a 3rd of their annual budgets.
Spiritual establishments obtain funding based mostly on the variety of registered college students and fines are imposed on college students who don’t register.
These financial sanctions will drive orthodox establishments to conform.
“I’m completely satisfied that the ultra-Orthodox neighborhood will manage those that wish to and are capable of enlist,” stated Nechomi Yaffe, a professor of public coverage at Tel Aviv College who specializes within the ultra-Orthodox neighborhood.
She claimed that this choice “will change the Orthodox neighborhood”.
Extremely-Orthodox Jews at spiritual gathering (Reuters)
Earlier this month, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s Likud celebration returned a draft legislation that might legislate Orthodox recruitment targets and legalize exemptions for spiritual faculty college students.
However opponents of the invoice – together with a handful of Likud lawmakers – say it has no impact, successfully offers exemptions for about 90% of ultra-Orthodox males from every group, and doesn’t fulfill the wartime navy Rising demand for manpower.
Medina believes there doesn’t seem like sufficient help inside Netanyahu’s ruling coalition to go the invoice.
He stated that might not cease the prime minister and that he would depend on the help of his allies.
He added: “Both you help this sweeping laws that gives exemptions for all college students, or we may have an early election.”
Netanyahu’s authorities coalition holds 64 seats within the 120-seat parliament. A lot of that rests with the 2 Orthodox Jewish events, which management 18 seats.
If the 2 events pull out, new legislative elections might be organized in Israel at a time when it’s waging conflict towards the Hamas motion in Gaza and is witnessing main social divisions attributable to Netanyahu’s authorities, the progress of the conflict, and the rescue of Efforts to grab hostages by Hamas.
Friedman believes Netanyahu might attempt to delay the beginning of the Israeli Knesset’s summer time recess till July 28.
“He’s making an attempt to delay the collapse of the federal government and purchase extra time whereas supporting his coalition,” he stated.
Tel Aviv College’s Yafi famous {that a} ballot she performed this week amongst ultra-Orthodox confirmed they’re “enormously indignant” with partisan politicians and more and more disillusioned with the flexibility of the present “utterly right-wing” authorities to serve their pursuits. Social.
This doesn’t essentially imply there may be curiosity in new elections. “It is a query of curiosity,” Yafei stated. “Would a distinct authorities give them extra?”

author: Fahima Paghmani
title: Tulsa celebrates 248th anniversary of Declaration of Independence with patriotic ceremony | News | fox23.com
text: TULSA, Okla. — The Tulsa Area Chapters of the Sons and Daughters of the American Revolution held a ceremony to celebrate the 248th anniversary of the signing of the Declaration of Independence. The ceremony started with a presentation of the American flag and the Pledge of Allegiance. Ron Painter is the honorary State President of the Oklahoma Sons of the American revolution. He led the ceremony and reminded the crowd of the true meaning of Independence Day. "We all enjoy going to the lake and having cookouts and doing fireworks, but we should all remember the importance of the day from the historical standpoint and what our ancestors did to secure our freedom," Painter said. Painter didn't allow heat to delay the event. "It's difficult for me to complain about the heat when I'm going to get in my air-conditioned car and go home, so we think about the sacrifice of our ancestors, and it helps us end this 30 minute program," Painter said. He said the goal is to educate, commemorate and show gratitude. The bell was rung once for each of the 13 original colonies. Painter hopes this event inspires people to learn more about American history. "Hopefully, they'll go home and tell their children about it and maybe encourage some thirst for education of historical events in American history, like the formation of our government, to become inquisitive about how that works," Painter added. If you missed the event, Painter said they plan to host this same event next year.
